Lunarpine wanted to keep the hapiness going but knew that he couldn't 
keep it to himself much longer. "I hate to change the subject but 
I've got bad news for you. The Arks been destroyed. I lost contact 
with it when I was chaseing down an infiltrator." he loosened his 
grip, looked her in the eye "And Strikers dead. He was killed by a 
creature calling himself Slayer." He wasn't telling the whole truth 
but it was enough of the truth for her to know. "I was sporting the 
marks of a battle with him when I returned." He kept his mind focused 
on her eyes so she wouldn't be able to read past that.

Foxfingers heard her in his mind again. "HMMPH" He muttered as he 
left. He couldn't tell if she was in his head or not. He just wanted 
her out.

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> Ice::
> She chuckled to herself. "Your secret is safe, I won't tell." she 
> thought to FoxFingers. "And I'll try to stay out of your mind from 
> now on. Your thoughts are your's and I won't intrude." She cut off 
> the link to FoxFingers, and stopped reading his mind.
> 
> She smiled and easied up on her hug with Lunarpine "And I won't 
> forget. But I'll be able to back you up in fights a lot better now 
> that I am what I am." She kissed his cheek. "I was worried about 
you 
> while you were gone. I prayed that the matrix would let us be 
> together again. And my prayers were answered. I'll not leave you 
> again."
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> > Lunarpine flinched as Ice got him in a "Bear" hug She was at 
least 
> > five times the strength she was as Shadow Wing. "Take it easy on 
> the 
> > metal, I don't want to end up in the CR chamber over a hug." He 
> > laughed and put his arms around her. "And don't think you're 
> getting 
> > out of my promise to protect you just because you're stronger 
than 
> > me." 
> > 
> > Foxfingers froze in his tracks for a moment when Ice entered his 
> > head. The robotic equivelincy to Homer Simpsons "DOH" came out as 
> he 
> > slapped himself in the forehead. "I'll remember that trick ." He 
> > thought back as he began down the hall again. He still wasn't 
sure 
> > about the extent of her powers but he still wanted his thoughts 
to 
> be 
> > kept secret. If Veratis knew that he'd broken into the maximal 
> > weapons locker then into a Predacon base he wouldn't be a happy 
> > scientist.
> > 
> > In the lab Veratis tried duplicating the steps that he'd taken 
but 
> > for some reason the bot who'd just recieved Dinobots DNA seemed 
> more 
> > agressive towards accepting it. Veratis figured it was just the 
> > difference betwee Ice and this bot until he realized that he'd 
> > forgotten to check the chip. Sure enough He was dealing with a 
> > Predacon Protoform this time. He tried to delay so he could 
program 
> > it but it was to late. The chip had taken effect and the Predacon 
> was 
> > on his way to being born.
> >
